Authentication

Learn how to implement secure authentication patterns in PhilJS, including sessions, JWTs, OAuth integration, and protecting routes.

Overview

PhilJS provides flexible authentication primitives that work with any auth provider or custom implementation. The core patterns include:

  • Session-based authentication
  • JWT (JSON Web Token) authentication
  • OAuth providers (Google, GitHub, etc.)
  • Protected routes and middleware

Setup

Terminal
$pnpm add philjs-auth
$# Optional: Add your preferred session store
$pnpm add @philjs/session-redis

Auth Context

1// lib/auth.ts
2import { createAuthContext } from 'philjs-auth';
3 
4export interface User {
5  id: string;
6  email: string;
7  name: string;
8  role: 'user' | 'admin';
9}
10 
11export const {
12  AuthProvider,
13  useAuth,
14  useUser,
15  useSession,
16} = createAuthContext<User>();
17 
18// App.tsx
19import { AuthProvider } from './lib/auth';
20 
21function App() {
22  return (
23    <AuthProvider>
24      <Router />
25    </AuthProvider>
26  );
27}

Session-Based Authentication

server/auth.tstypescript
1// server/auth.ts
2'use server';
3 
4import { createSession, destroySession, getSession } from 'philjs-auth/server';
5import { db } from './db';
6import { hash, verify } from './password';
7 
8export async function signUp(email: string, password: string, name: string) {
9  // Check if user exists
10  const existing = await db.user.findUnique({ where: { email } });
11  if (existing) {
12    throw new Error('Email already registered');
13  }
14 
15  // Create user
16  const user = await db.user.create({
17    data: {
18      email,
19      password: await hash(password),
20      name,
21    },
22  });
23 
24  // Create session
25  await createSession({ userId: user.id });
26 
27  return { success: true };
28}
29 
30export async function signIn(email: string, password: string) {
31  const user = await db.user.findUnique({ where: { email } });
32 
33  if (!user || !(await verify(password, user.password))) {
34    throw new Error('Invalid email or password');
35  }
36 
37  await createSession({ userId: user.id });
38 
39  return { success: true };
40}
41 
42export async function signOut() {
43  await destroySession();
44  return { success: true };
45}
46 
47export async function getCurrentUser() {
48  const session = await getSession();
49  if (!session?.userId) return null;
50 
51  return db.user.findUnique({
52    where: { id: session.userId },
53    select: { id: true, email: true, name: true, role: true },
54  });
55}

Login Form

1import { createSignal } from 'philjs-core';
2import { useAuth } from './lib/auth';
3import { signIn } from './server/auth';
4 
5function LoginForm() {
6  const [email, setEmail] = createSignal('');
7  const [password, setPassword] = createSignal('');
8  const [error, setError] = createSignal<string | null>(null);
9  const [loading, setLoading] = createSignal(false);
10  const { refresh } = useAuth();
11 
12  const handleSubmit = async (e: Event) => {
13    e.preventDefault();
14    setError(null);
15    setLoading(true);
16 
17    try {
18      await signIn(email(), password());
19      await refresh(); // Refresh auth state
20      // Navigate to dashboard
21    } catch (err) {
22      setError(err.message);
23    } finally {
24      setLoading(false);
25    }
26  };
27 
28  return (
29    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
30      {error() && (
31        <div className="alert alert-error">{error()}</div>
32      )}
33 
34      <input
35        type="email"
36        value={email()}
37        onInput={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
38        placeholder="Email"
39        required
40      />
41 
42      <input
43        type="password"
44        value={password()}
45        onInput={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
46        placeholder="Password"
47        required
48      />
49 
50      <button type="submit" disabled={loading()}>
51        {loading() ? 'Signing in...' : 'Sign In'}
52      </button>
53    </form>
54  );
55}

Protected Routes

1// components/ProtectedRoute.tsx
2import { useAuth } from './lib/auth';
3import { Navigate } from 'philjs-router';
4 
5interface ProtectedRouteProps {
6  children: JSX.Element;
7  requiredRole?: 'user' | 'admin';
8}
9 
10function ProtectedRoute({ children, requiredRole }: ProtectedRouteProps) {
11  const { user, loading } = useAuth();
12 
13  // Show loading state while checking auth
14  if (loading()) {
15    return <LoadingSpinner />;
16  }
17 
18  // Redirect to login if not authenticated
19  if (!user()) {
20    return <Navigate to="/login" replace />;
21  }
22 
23  // Check role if required
24  if (requiredRole && user()?.role !== requiredRole) {
25    return <Navigate to="/unauthorized" replace />;
26  }
27 
28  return children;
29}
30 
31// Usage in routes
32import { Route, Routes } from 'philjs-router';
33 
34function AppRoutes() {
35  return (
36    <Routes>
37      <Route path="/login" component={LoginPage} />
38      <Route path="/signup" component={SignupPage} />
39 
40      {/* Protected routes */}
41      <Route
42        path="/dashboard"
43        component={() => (
44          <ProtectedRoute>
45            <Dashboard />
46          </ProtectedRoute>
47        )}
48      />
49 
50      <Route
51        path="/admin"
52        component={() => (
53          <ProtectedRoute requiredRole="admin">
54            <AdminPanel />
55          </ProtectedRoute>
56        )}
57      />
58    </Routes>
59  );
60}

OAuth Integration

1// server/oauth.ts
2'use server';
3 
4import { OAuth2Client } from 'philjs-auth/oauth';
5import { createSession } from 'philjs-auth/server';
6import { db } from './db';
7 
8const googleClient = new OAuth2Client({
9  clientId: process.env.GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID!,
10  clientSecret: process.env.GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET!,
11  redirectUri: `${process.env.APP_URL}/auth/google/callback`,
12});
13 
14export async function getGoogleAuthUrl() {
15  return googleClient.getAuthorizationUrl({
16    scope: ['email', 'profile'],
17    state: crypto.randomUUID(),
18  });
19}
20 
21export async function handleGoogleCallback(code: string) {
22  const tokens = await googleClient.getTokens(code);
23  const profile = await googleClient.getUserInfo(tokens.accessToken);
24 
25  // Find or create user
26  let user = await db.user.findUnique({
27    where: { email: profile.email },
28  });
29 
30  if (!user) {
31    user = await db.user.create({
32      data: {
33        email: profile.email,
34        name: profile.name,
35        avatar: profile.picture,
36        provider: 'google',
37        providerId: profile.id,
38      },
39    });
40  }
41 
42  await createSession({ userId: user.id });
43 
44  return { success: true };
45}
46 
47// components/GoogleLoginButton.tsx
48import { getGoogleAuthUrl } from './server/oauth';
49 
50function GoogleLoginButton() {
51  const handleClick = async () => {
52    const url = await getGoogleAuthUrl();
53    window.location.href = url;
54  };
55 
56  return (
57    <button onClick={handleClick} className="google-btn">
58      <GoogleIcon />
59      Continue with Google
60    </button>
61  );
62}

JWT Authentication

1// server/jwt-auth.ts
2'use server';
3 
4import { SignJWT, jwtVerify } from 'jose';
5 
6const secret = new TextEncoder().encode(process.env.JWT_SECRET);
7 
8export async function createToken(payload: { userId: string; role: string }) {
9  return new SignJWT(payload)
10    .setProtectedHeader({ alg: 'HS256' })
11    .setIssuedAt()
12    .setExpirationTime('1h')
13    .sign(secret);
14}
15 
16export async function verifyToken(token: string) {
17  try {
18    const { payload } = await jwtVerify(token, secret);
19    return payload;
20  } catch {
21    return null;
22  }
23}
24 
25export async function createRefreshToken(userId: string) {
26  return new SignJWT({ userId })
27    .setProtectedHeader({ alg: 'HS256' })
28    .setIssuedAt()
29    .setExpirationTime('7d')
30    .sign(secret);
31}
32 
33// Middleware for protected API routes
34export async function authMiddleware(request: Request) {
35  const token = request.headers.get('Authorization')?.split(' ')[1];
36 
37  if (!token) {
38    return new Response('Unauthorized', { status: 401 });
39  }
40 
41  const payload = await verifyToken(token);
42  if (!payload) {
43    return new Response('Invalid token', { status: 401 });
44  }
45 
46  // Attach user to request context
47  return { userId: payload.userId, role: payload.role };
48}

Authentication in Rust

1use philjs_auth::prelude::*;
2use axum::{
3    extract::State,
4    middleware::from_fn_with_state,
5    routing::{get, post},
6    Router,
7};
8 
9#[derive(Clone)]
10struct AppState {
11    db: Database,
12    session_store: SessionStore,
13}
14 
15async fn sign_in(
16    State(state): State<AppState>,
17    Json(credentials): Json<Credentials>,
18) -> Result<Json<AuthResponse>, AuthError> {
19    let user = state.db
20        .find_user_by_email(&credentials.email)
21        .await?
22        .ok_or(AuthError::InvalidCredentials)?;
23 
24    if !verify_password(&credentials.password, &user.password_hash) {
25        return Err(AuthError::InvalidCredentials);
26    }
27 
28    let session = state.session_store.create(user.id).await?;
29 
30    Ok(Json(AuthResponse {
31        user: user.into(),
32        token: session.token,
33    }))
34}
35 
36async fn require_auth(
37    State(state): State<AppState>,
38    mut request: Request,
39    next: Next,
40) -> Result<Response, AuthError> {
41    let token = request
42        .headers()
43        .get("Authorization")
44        .and_then(|h| h.to_str().ok())
45        .and_then(|h| h.strip_prefix("Bearer "))
46        .ok_or(AuthError::Unauthorized)?;
47 
48    let session = state.session_store
49        .validate(token)
50        .await?
51        .ok_or(AuthError::Unauthorized)?;
52 
53    request.extensions_mut().insert(session.user_id);
54    Ok(next.run(request).await)
55}
56 
57fn app() -> Router {
58    let state = AppState::new();
59 
60    Router::new()
61        .route("/api/auth/signin", post(sign_in))
62        .route("/api/auth/signup", post(sign_up))
63        .route(
64            "/api/protected",
65            get(protected_route)
66                .layer(from_fn_with_state(state.clone(), require_auth)),
67        )
68        .with_state(state)
69}

Auth Middleware for SSR

1// middleware.ts
2import { createMiddleware } from 'philjs-ssr/middleware';
3import { getSession } from 'philjs-auth/server';
4 
5export const authMiddleware = createMiddleware(async (request, next) => {
6  const session = await getSession(request);
7  const isAuthPage = request.url.includes('/login') ||
8                     request.url.includes('/signup');
9 
10  // Redirect authenticated users away from auth pages
11  if (session?.userId && isAuthPage) {
12    return Response.redirect(new URL('/dashboard', request.url));
13  }
14 
15  // Protect dashboard routes
16  if (!session?.userId && request.url.includes('/dashboard')) {
17    return Response.redirect(new URL('/login', request.url));
18  }
19 
20  return next();
21});
!

Security Best Practices

  • Always use HTTPS in production
  • Store passwords with strong hashing (bcrypt, argon2)
  • Implement rate limiting on auth endpoints
  • Use secure, httpOnly cookies for sessions
  • Validate and sanitize all user inputs
